brief_summary.textblock:
Insufficient cognitive control over emotional distracters is characteristic for major
      depressive disorder (MDD). Hypoactivation of the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (dlPFC) is
      associated with this deficit. In this study the investigators assess the effect of a
      decrease of dlPFC activity in healthy subjects by cathodal transcranial direct current
      stimulation (tDCS) on cognitive control.

      In a double-blinded, balanced randomized, sham-controlled crossover trial the investigators
      determine the effect of a single-session of cathodal tDCS to the left dlPFC on cognitive
      control in healthy subjects. To assess the cognitive control the investigators use a delayed
      response working memory task (DWM)and an arithmetic inhibition task (AIT) with pictures of
      varying valence.

clinical_study.brief_title: Interference With Cognitive Control by Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

        psychiatric or neurological disorders seizures cardiac pacemakers

intervention.description: Cathodal transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) 20min, 1mA, F3 (EEG 10/20), reference right M. deltoideus
Sham transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) 40s, 1mA, F3 (EEG 10/20), reference right M. deltoideus

facility.name: Department of Psychiatry and Psychotherapy, University of Tübingen

oversight_info.authority: Germany: Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices

primary_outcome.description: Correctness is defined as the percentage of correct responses in the DWM and AIT
primary_outcome.measure: Correctness and reaction time of response
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 30 min starting 5 min after the initiation of stimulation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Basic Science
